intro: Bupleurum nebulosum, commonly known as clouded bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Bupleurum nebulosum is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
